alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:55PM MST until February 24 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Sawatch Mountains and Western Chaffee County Above 9000 Feet and the Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a long-lasting event over multiple days. Periods of light to moderate snow could occasionally give way to periods of heavy snow and reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
